did.abstract: Sister of Michigan public figure Frank Murphy. Correspondence and other papers relating in part to her activities in the Philippines.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of the Hon. George Murphy (donor no. 3074).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research. However, researchers must sign the Murphy contract before access to the collection will be given.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Marguerite Murphy papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Marguerite Murphy was the sister of Detroit mayor, Governor General and US High Commissioner of the Philippines, and Michigan governor, Frank Murphy. During the years when Murphy served in the Philippines, 1933-1935, his sister accompanied him and helped in many of the ceremonial functions of the office.

scopecontent.p: The collection is divided into two series: Correspondence and Other Papers. The collection is strongest for its documentation of Murphy's service in the Philippines during the mid-1930s. Most of the letters are with her parents and her three brothers.

did.unittitle: Telegrams of sympathy (sample) sent to George Murphy and Marguerite Murphy Teahan upon the death of their brother Frank Murphy, July 1949
Letters of condolences and responses sent to George Murphy and Marguerite Murphy Teahan upon the death of their brother Frank Murphy, July 1949
